[{'created': '2019-03-24 21:03:45.000000000', 'message': 'Replace openstack.org git:// URLs with https://

This is a mechanically generated change to replace openstack.org
git:// URLs with https:// equivalents.

This is in aid of a planned future move of the git hosting
infrastructure to a self-hosted instance of gitea (https://gitea.io),
which does not support the git wire protocol at this stage.

This update should result in no functional change.

For more information see the thread at

 http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-discuss/2019-March/003825.html

Change-Id: Ib54071ba270b7a5f6a90ccd026f5547a6fdb3c37
'}]
commit_message:
Replace openstack.org git:// URLs with https://

This is a mechanically generated change to replace openstack.org
git:// URLs with https:// equivalents.

This is in aid of a planned future move of the git hosting
infrastructure to a self-hosted instance of gitea (https://gitea.io),
which does not support the git wire protocol at this stage.

This update should result in no functional change.

For more information see the thread at

 http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-discuss/2019-March/003825.html

Change-Id: Ib54071ba270b7a5f6a90ccd026f5547a6fdb3c37

commit_message:
Fix 'container' field in VolumeMapping object

Change the type of 'container' field from Container to ContainerBase.
This will allow a VolumeMapping object reference to any type
of container. This will fix the model of mapping volume to
capsule container.

Change-Id: I2f011b09d2426168153f3a114b7b5d0d93815cff
(cherry picked from commit d15d67cd435ae060fb8c43622d1ebe2f5c25e747)

revisions:
[{'created': '2019-03-26 15:50:00.000000000', 'message': 'Improve detection of multipathd running

There is a case where `multipathd show status` should fail, yet it
doesn't exit with an error code. Instead it returns 0. Error is printed
to stdout as "error receiving packet".

This means that enforce will not work as expected.

The multipathd error got fixed here:
https://www.redhat.com/archives/dm-devel/2015-March/msg00136.html

But that patch is missing in some packages, so this patch adds a
workaround to detect the error base on the stdout of the multipathd show
status command.

Closes-Bug: #1789699
Change-Id: I1cb29782541e3fe53b0b1744ab36f56464cd2135
(cherry picked from commit 028af871de8a3f45f4cc8342e92d5586a7058e5a)
(cherry picked from commit f2fed213f6b1d36513504d0ec4ebbfeeddc52b94)
'}]
commit_message:
Improve detection of multipathd running

There is a case where `multipathd show status` should fail, yet it
doesn't exit with an error code. Instead it returns 0. Error is printed
to stdout as "error receiving packet".

This means that enforce will not work as expected.

The multipathd error got fixed here:
https://www.redhat.com/archives/dm-devel/2015-March/msg00136.html

But that patch is missing in some packages, so this patch adds a
workaround to detect the error base on the stdout of the multipathd show
status command.

Closes-Bug: #1789699
Change-Id: I1cb29782541e3fe53b0b1744ab36f56464cd2135
(cherry picked from commit 028af871de8a3f45f4cc8342e92d5586a7058e5a)
(cherry picked from commit f2fed213f6b1d36513504d0ec4ebbfeeddc52b94)

commit_message:
Notify all back ends when clustering is complete

Before this change there was a race condition in which keystone would
hand out its local IP rather than the VIP when in HA mode and never
update clients other than on the identity-service relation.

This change guarantees the other relations are also updated with HA VIP
information.

Change-Id: Ib2ea3103c06a7a06bb1d04b6c7e872f36d12c1c4

This change fixes a race in _cleanup_build_artifacts. We were creating
the instance mapping before the instance record was complete. Creating
the instance mapping exposes the cell's version of the instance to the
API. If the API happened to fetch it before it was finished being
created it would return incomplete data.

the instance mapping to point at the cell in which the instance was
created before the instance record was complete, i.e. before the related
BDMs and tags were created in the cell DB. Updating the instance mapping

commit_message:
Fix incomplete instance data returned after build failure

This change fixes a race in _cleanup_build_artifacts. We were updating
the instance mapping to point at the cell in which the instance was
created before the instance record was complete, i.e. before the related
BDMs and tags were created in the cell DB. Updating the instance mapping
exposes the cell's version of the instance to the API. If the API happened
to fetch it before it was finished being created it would return
incomplete data.

Co-Authored-By: Matt Riedemann <mriedem.os@gmail.com>

Closes-Bug: #1820337
Change-Id: If966eb1161c842ff49aa530e4482dbca87b61a3e

commit_message:
Add Leap 15 jobs

We had leap 15 in roles everywhere, yet, we don't exercise it
in the integrated.

We should fix that, as Rocky is supporting (experimentally) both
42.3 and 15.0.

Change-Id: I17e7d7516551e6781e48fa2d6157a49faf1e0624

commit_message:
Update UPPER_CONSTRAINTS_FILE for stable/stein

Update the URL to the upper-constraints file to point to the redirect
rule on releases.openstack.org so that anyone working on this branch
will switch to the correct upper-constraints list automatically when
the requirements repository branches.

Until the requirements repository has as stable/stein branch, tests will
continue to use the upper-constraints list on master.

Change-Id: I73bda119de6859df2a354e9b9848117d643efd6e

commit_message:
Update role for new source build process

The variables ceilometer_developer_mode and ceilometer_venv_download
no longer carry any meaning. This review changes ceilometer to
do the equivalent of what developer_mode was all the time,
meaning that it always builds the venv and never requires
the repo server, but it will use a repo server when available.

As part of this, we move the source build out of its own file
because it's now a single task to include the venv build role.
This is just to make it easier to follow the code.

We also change include_tasks to import_tasks and include_role
to import_role so that the tags in the python_venv_build role
will work.

Change-Id: Ib6423249ad6d8c24382a0d82229f766d34255ee9

commit_message:
Update role for new source build process

The variable mistral_developer_mode and mistral_venv_download
no longer carry any meaning. This review changes mistral to
do the equivalent of what developer_mode was all the time,
meaning that it always builds the venv and never requires
the repo server, but it will use a repo server when available.

As part of this, we move the source build out of its own file
because it's now a single task to include the venv build role.
This is just to make it easier to follow the code.

Change-Id: Ibb0a20eeec763f2051c8577da5a91ddc5b9a9e62

commit_message:
use EXT_PARENT_RESOURCE_MAPPING from neutron-lib

The neutron.common.constants.EXT_PARENT_RESOURCE_MAPPING constant lives
in neutron-lib. This patch consumes it by removing it from neutron
and switching all uses over to libs constant.

NeutronLibImpact

Change-Id: Ib7ea6dea58bf211a2da2b103cb526233df04ba49

commit_message:
Update UPPER_CONSTRAINTS_FILE for stable/stein

Update the URL to the upper-constraints file to point to the redirect
rule on releases.openstack.org so that anyone working on this branch
will switch to the correct upper-constraints list automatically when
the requirements repository branches.

Until the requirements repository has as stable/stein branch, tests will
continue to use the upper-constraints list on master.

Change-Id: I2e291f9bcefa1dd354ac6abff9174ed30187d126

commit_message:
Replace openstack.org git:// URLs with https://

This is a mechanically generated change to replace openstack.org
git:// URLs with https:// equivalents.

This is in aid of a planned future move of the git hosting
infrastructure to a self-hosted instance of gitea (https://gitea.io),
which does not support the git wire protocol at this stage.

This update should result in no functional change.

For more information see the thread at

 http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-discuss/2019-March/003825.html

Change-Id: Ic0ad68e63a339b392fac860b69cfd1030a0126d7

commit_message:
Mount openshift-ansible working dir with 'z' option

On RHEL8, deployment fails with a bunch of permission issue while the
openshift-ansible container image tries to read files from /var/lib/mistral/openshift/openshift/inventory/.

We need to add 'z' option while mounting the
/var/lib/mistral/openshift volume.

Change-Id: I24067f97eb36e475f873e3a3ea06a488fef95d90
Closes-Bug: #1821437

messages: [{'account_id': 28008, 'date': '2019-03-27 02:24:03.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 7353, 'date': '2019-03-27 03:03:29.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 6816, 'date': '2019-03-27 11:07:17.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2019-03-27 02:24:03.000000000', 'message': "Update role for new source build process

The variables magum_developer_mode and magnum_venv_download
no longer carry any meaning. This review changes magnum to
do the equivalent of what developer_mode was all the time,
meaning that it always builds the venv and never requires
the repo server, but it will use a repo server when available.

As part of this, we move the source build out of its own file
because it's now a single task to include the venv build role.
This is just to make it easier to follow the code.

Change-Id: I89177a702cd6f31f4b26b4d8fa260fd38a895ba0
"}]
commit_message:
Update role for new source build process

The variables magum_developer_mode and magnum_venv_download
no longer carry any meaning. This review changes magnum to
do the equivalent of what developer_mode was all the time,
meaning that it always builds the venv and never requires
the repo server, but it will use a repo server when available.

As part of this, we move the source build out of its own file
because it's now a single task to include the venv build role.
This is just to make it easier to follow the code.

Change-Id: I89177a702cd6f31f4b26b4d8fa260fd38a895ba0

commit_message:
Replace openstack.org git:// URLs with https://

This is a mechanically generated change to replace openstack.org
git:// URLs with https:// equivalents.

This is in aid of a planned future move of the git hosting
infrastructure to a self-hosted instance of gitea (https://gitea.io),
which does not support the git wire protocol at this stage.

This update should result in no functional change.

For more information see the thread at

 http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-discuss/2019-March/003825.html

commit_message:
Temp set chronyd service state to restarted after config changes

https://review.openstack.org/#/c/644562/ allows the user
to set the state of the chronyd service after config.
This setting is a workaround for:
https://github.com/ansible/ansible/issues/37512.

This review adds that setting for CI.

Depends-On: https://review.openstack.org/#/c/644562
Change-Id: I76b54ecb207ecd89cf76a24565b3161c936fe92c

commit_message:
Add option to force restart state after chrony config change

This review adds a parameter to allow envs that
rely custom ntp servers to force the restart after
config changes - even if the handler is skipped.

See: https://github.com/ansible/ansible/issues/37512

The service state can be set to 'restarted' rather
than the default 'started' - as a workaround to the
ansible bug in the current version in use - 2.6.14.

Change-Id: I17749a1289cb8b0b1e31d88840c9f406bd54d1dd

[{'created': '2019-03-27 07:40:34.000000000', 'message': 'Add "root_execution" mapped property to WorkflowExecution model

* We need to avoid using direct DB queries w/o using a mapped
  model where possible for performance sake. Using a mapped entity
  property is always more efficient because it's cached in an
  SQLAlchemy session.

Closes-Bug: #1821860

Change-Id: I2d7652ea0cff8f2db7259d285ac98c582bf15b62
(cherry picked from commit 32c96b1b6c340c10a12d6f598268198083681031)
'}]
commit_message:
Add "root_execution" mapped property to WorkflowExecution model

* We need to avoid using direct DB queries w/o using a mapped
  model where possible for performance sake. Using a mapped entity
  property is always more efficient because it's cached in an
  SQLAlchemy session.

Closes-Bug: #1821860

Change-Id: I2d7652ea0cff8f2db7259d285ac98c582bf15b62
(cherry picked from commit 32c96b1b6c340c10a12d6f598268198083681031)

commit_message:
Update master for stable/stein

Add file to the reno documentation build to show release notes for
stable/stein.

Use pbr instruction to increment the minor version number
automatically so that master versions are higher than the versions on
stable/stein.

Sem-Ver: feature

commit_message:
Replace openstack.org git:// URLs with https://

This is a mechanically generated change to replace openstack.org
git:// URLs with https:// equivalents.

This is in aid of a planned future move of the git hosting
infrastructure to a self-hosted instance of gitea (https://gitea.io),
which does not support the git wire protocol at this stage.

This update should result in no functional change.

For more information see the thread at

 http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-discuss/2019-March/003825.html

Change-Id: I015d1926f391bf2e198adf94eba69a1db2cbdef7

subject: Add the support to customize the console access port
messages:
[{'account_id': 2711, 'date': '2019-03-27 02:07:35.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 20870, 'date': '2019-03-27 10:05:20.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: Code-Review-1

The openstack-tox-py35 failure is due to an ostestr bug; you'll need to backport the stestr fix to get it to pass check and gate.

However, this is backporting a feature, and generally only bug fixes are backported.  New stable charms will be released in the next couple of weeks, so I'm wondering whether this backport is needed."}, {'account_id': 2711, 'date': '2019-03-27 11:18:25.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

thanks Alex, I will abandon this patch'}, {'account_id': 2711, 'date': '2019-03-27 11:18:34.000000000', 'content': 'Abandoned'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2019-03-27 02:07:35.000000000', 'message': 'Add the support to customize the console access port

For novnc, need to set novncproxy_port in proxy nodes and
novncproxy_base_url in nova-compute nodes.
For xvpvnc, need to set xvpvncproxy_port in proxy nodes and
xvpvncproxy_base_url in nova-compute nodes.
For spice, need to set spicehtml5proxy_port in proxy nodes and
spicehtml5proxy_base_url in nova-compute nodes.

When release >= Mitaka, novncproxy_port and xvpvncproxy_port
are moved from [default] section into [vnc] section.
spicehtml5proxy_port is renamed to html5proxy_port and moved
to [spice] section.

So eventually the console access port can be customized by:

juju config nova-cloud-controller console-access-protocol=novnc
juju config nova-cloud-controller console-access-port=xx

If console-access-port is not defined, then default port is 6080
for novpc, 6081 for xvpvnc, 6082 for spice.

Change-Id: I4775ad42ba11b0c28163bf7e3718c56d18a2031f
Closes-Bug: #1800753
Signed-off-by: Zhang Hua <joshua.zhang@canonical.com>
(cherry picked from commit b182ffa7f76c28220f6ee2430e7c320395a55956)
'}]
commit_message:
Add the support to customize the console access port

For novnc, need to set novncproxy_port in proxy nodes and
novncproxy_base_url in nova-compute nodes.
For xvpvnc, need to set xvpvncproxy_port in proxy nodes and
xvpvncproxy_base_url in nova-compute nodes.
For spice, need to set spicehtml5proxy_port in proxy nodes and
spicehtml5proxy_base_url in nova-compute nodes.

When release >= Mitaka, novncproxy_port and xvpvncproxy_port
are moved from [default] section into [vnc] section.
spicehtml5proxy_port is renamed to html5proxy_port and moved
to [spice] section.

So eventually the console access port can be customized by:

juju config nova-cloud-controller console-access-protocol=novnc
juju config nova-cloud-controller console-access-port=xx

If console-access-port is not defined, then default port is 6080
for novpc, 6081 for xvpvnc, 6082 for spice.

Change-Id: I4775ad42ba11b0c28163bf7e3718c56d18a2031f
Closes-Bug: #1800753
Signed-off-by: Zhang Hua <joshua.zhang@canonical.com>
(cherry picked from commit b182ffa7f76c28220f6ee2430e7c320395a55956)

commit_message:
placement: 1.0.0.0rc2 from stable/stein

Prepare an rc2 release of placement as a 1.0.0.0rc2. Three of the
four changes are administrivia. 0c9b38a8 is a bug fix in the
PlacementFixture which is used by nova (in stein and in master).
The bug was found in the window of time after placement had cut
stable/stein and before nova did.

No further backports are pending.

$ git log --oneline --no-merges 1.0.0.0rc1..bbd90ca2a671b76cda6844a3a8de5c46f587b7a5
bbd90ca2 (origin/stable/stein, gerrit/stable/stein) Replace openstack.org git:// URLs with https://
0c9b38a8 Add register_opts param to PlacementFixture
60efe8ac Update UPPER_CONSTRAINTS_FILE for stable/stein
de7c123c Update .gitreview for stable/stein

Change-Id: I9719f9a139755ac2848fb259c77e881350006e8a

commit_message:
Extract announce info from deliverable file

There were some undocumented expectations for formatting information in
repo's README files to be extracted by the email announcement scripts
that many (most?) repos are not following. Since we have information
like the bug reporting details in the deliverable files, this attempts
to parse the info from there.

Story: #2005279
Task: #30132

Change-Id: I31643d9c4f22c199c9fc385711fdf530c2836631
Signed-off-by: Sean McGinnis <sean.mcginnis@gmail.com>

Our announce email included a few errors in the paths provided. If the
git remote.origin.url ended with ".git" the tarball path was wrong. We
were also using the package name for git and doc paths incorrectly. This
fixes the name used so the resulting links are correct.

Story: #2005279
Task: #30131

Change-Id: I7a64761778b7391c0f3188b1177f03a7e712bd2a
Signed-off-by: Sean McGinnis <sean.mcginnis@gmail.com>
'}]
commit_message:
Fix announce email paths

Our announce email included a few errors in the paths provided. If the
git remote.origin.url ended with ".git" the tarball path was wrong. We
were also using the package name for git and doc paths incorrectly. This
fixes the name used so the resulting links are correct.

Story: #2005279
Task: #30131

Change-Id: I7a64761778b7391c0f3188b1177f03a7e712bd2a
Signed-off-by: Sean McGinnis <sean.mcginnis@gmail.com>

We don't need an API change for this, it's a bug."}, {'account_id': 26458, 'date': '2018-12-19 03:33:01.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

(1 comment)

Thanks Takashi, Matt for review.
@Matt, Yes, this is a bug (No need to add microversion), I want to use this patch to record its changes. I think this change is more meaningful.

I saw your comment on bug 1675791, which is reasonable from the image document, but the admin user creates a snapshot of the instance of the demo project, I think the user under the demo project should have permission to see the instance snapshot (image), otherwise the instance snapshot it doesn't make any sense to the demo user (Except set sharing to it). When the admin user performs this operation, the project_id of the generated image is modified to demo user, and the admin user can also read and use it.
From the perspective of communicating with our customers, this change is more reasonable."}, {'account_id': 26458, 'date': '2018-12-19 03:46:30.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 3.'}, {'account_id': 6873, 'date': '2018-12-21 21:07:18.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3:

We don't really need a spec for a bug fix..."}, {'account_id': 6873, 'date': '2019-01-14 22:35:34.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Code-Review-1

This should fix your issue:

https://review.openstack.org/#/c/630769/'}, {'account_id': 26458, 'date': '2019-03-27 10:51:06.000000000', 'content': 'Abandoned'}]

commit_message:
Support admin to specify project to create snapshot

The snapshot created by the super administrator for the instance under
the project should belong to the target project, so that the user under
the project has the permission to create or restore an instance using
the instance snapshot.

Blueprint: support-admin-to-specify-project-to-create-snapshot
Change-Id: Icc4c1b72e3cbff346780a1e5ccd1fe8f6f3bea74

subject: Use temporary redirects for future series
messages:
[{'account_id': 15343, 'date': '2019-03-26 06:00:37.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 12898, 'date': '2019-03-26 21:33:41.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2

Thanks Tim.

Looks good to me.

Did you hit this somewhere or are you just *really* observant?'}, {'account_id': 15343, 'date': '2019-03-26 22:06:40.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

Just been burned by 301s getting cached before :-) So I got a little nervous about pointing at one that I knew should change in https://review.openstack.org/#/c/647544/'}, {'account_id': 17068, 'date': '2019-03-27 09:01:28.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 308, 'date': '2019-03-27 10:40:21.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2019-03-26 06:00:37.000000000', 'message': "Use temporary redirects for future series

Per [1],

> [Permanent redirections] are meant to last forever. They imply that
> the original URL should not be used anymore and that the new one is
> preferred. Search engine robots trigger an update of the associated
> URL for the resource in their indexes.

That doesn't seem like a good idea when we *know* that the redirect
location is going to change, and on a reasonably short time scale. Use
302 instead; 303 or 307 would probably work as well, but 302 should have
very broad client support.

[1] https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/HTTP/Redirections

Change-Id: Ia2e8c46c27ac97217576afdd1677efba4b99fc37
"}]
commit_message:
Use temporary redirects for future series

Per [1],

> [Permanent redirections] are meant to last forever. They imply that
> the original URL should not be used anymore and that the new one is
> preferred. Search engine robots trigger an update of the associated
> URL for the resource in their indexes.

That doesn't seem like a good idea when we *know* that the redirect
location is going to change, and on a reasonably short time scale. Use
302 instead; 303 or 307 would probably work as well, but 302 should have
very broad client support.

[1] https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/HTTP/Redirections

Change-Id: Ia2e8c46c27ac97217576afdd1677efba4b99fc37

subject: Add option to disable container builds on specific hosts
messages: [{'account_id': 7353, 'date': '2019-03-26 19:12:55.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Cherry Picked from branch master.'}, {'account_id': 14552, 'date': '2019-03-26 19:13:26.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+1'}, {'account_id': 1004, 'date': '2019-03-26 21:15:21.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 7353, 'date': '2019-03-27 02:05:33.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1'}, {'account_id': 7353, 'date': '2019-03-27 02:05:44.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: -Code-Review -Workflow'}, {'account_id': 25023, 'date': '2019-03-27 07:33:13.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Workflow+1'}, {'account_id': 25023, 'date': '2019-03-27 07:33:28.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 28619, 'date': '2019-03-27 08:15:37.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:\n\nrecheck failed openstack-ansible-deploy-aio_metal-ubuntu-bionic with fatal: unable to access 'https://gitlab.freedesktop.org/spice/spice-html5.git/'"}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2019-03-26 19:12:55.000000000', 'message': 'Add option to disable container builds on specific hosts

This change adds an option to disable any and all containers within a given host
The new option "no_containers" is a boolean option and has a default value of
false. When set true no containers will be created in inventory for a given machine.

This will allow deployers to simply disable container builds on specific machines
when nessisary. This is usefule when a deployer simply wants to deploy openstack
in a flattened environment. This has also been useful in cases where
infrastructure hosts may reside within virtualization solutions like OpenStack,
VirtualBox, or VMWare which implement strong port security rules which makes
container networking difficult or impossible.

To implement the change simply add the "no_containers: true|false" option to
a host entry in the openstack_user_config.yml

Change-Id: I8bed3e498a431e2683956e1009d9d9ece9fdb272
Signed-off-by: Kevin Carter <kevin@cloudnull.com>
(cherry picked from commit 9229315a1adea8ebbddb182c20e4d1202fc0168a)
'}]
commit_message:
Add option to disable container builds on specific hosts

This change adds an option to disable any and all containers within a given host
The new option "no_containers" is a boolean option and has a default value of
false. When set true no containers will be created in inventory for a given machine.

This will allow deployers to simply disable container builds on specific machines
when nessisary. This is usefule when a deployer simply wants to deploy openstack
in a flattened environment. This has also been useful in cases where
infrastructure hosts may reside within virtualization solutions like OpenStack,
VirtualBox, or VMWare which implement strong port security rules which makes
container networking difficult or impossible.

To implement the change simply add the "no_containers: true|false" option to
a host entry in the openstack_user_config.yml

Change-Id: I8bed3e498a431e2683956e1009d9d9ece9fdb272
Signed-off-by: Kevin Carter <kevin@cloudnull.com>
(cherry picked from commit 9229315a1adea8ebbddb182c20e4d1202fc0168a)

commit_message:
Fix HashMap field mapping comparison

This fixes hashmap field mapping comparisons by ensuring that the
metadata to compare is a string. Some metadatas can be integers or floats
(vcpus or ram for example). Given that field values are stored as strings,
these values did never match.

Change-Id: I6d768418d2e91ab62d6af4cb670c148424828fd4

commit_message:
Bump CI post-run timeout to 2 hours

We are seeing a number of POST_FAILURES in the periodic publishing jobs,
with jobs timing out pushing images to Docker hub. Try bumping the
post timeout to 2 hours.

Change-Id: I69b5610b712560e2d617933e639e77041953e21c

keystone_service_internaluri_insecure with os_tempest default

define in os_tempest tempest.yml playbook.

commit_message:
Add 'IP' and 'HOPOPT' protocols to constants

Protocol number zero (0) is supported in security groups,
meaning all IP protocols, so it should be in the constants
dictionary.  For IPv6 it's used for HOPOPT, and has the
same effect in iptables.

Change-Id: Ifa3189a4efc3e184139ce6470731acb07fea23c1

[{'created': '2019-03-13 19:55:02.000000000', 'message': 'Add functional recreate test for bug 1819963

When resizing a server that was not created in an explicit
zone, the scheduler can pick a host in another zone and
conductor will update the instance.availability_zone value
for the new dest host zone.

The problem is when reverting the resize, the server goes
back to the original source host/zone but the
instance.availability_zone value in the database is not
updated which can lead to incorrect results when listing
servers and filtering by zone.

This adds a functional recreate test for the bug.

Change-Id: Ib107650d6a2c991c26b646a0dd10ddc7a3fb7e56
Related-Bug: #1819963
'}, {'created': '2019-03-14 01:12:44.000000000', 'message': 'Add functional recreate test for bug 1819963

zone, the scheduler can pick a host in another zone and
conductor will update the instance.availability_zone value
for the new dest host zone.

instance.availability_zone value in the database is not

Change-Id: Ib107650d6a2c991c26b646a0dd10ddc7a3fb7e56
Related-Bug: #1819963

commit_message:
Add functional recreate test for bug 1819963

When resizing a server that was not created in an explicit
zone, the scheduler can pick a host in another zone and
conductor will update the instance.availability_zone value
for the new dest host zone.

The problem is when reverting the resize, the server goes
back to the original source host/zone but the
instance.availability_zone value in the database is not
updated which can lead to incorrect results when listing
servers and filtering by zone.

This adds a functional recreate test for the bug.

Change-Id: Ib107650d6a2c991c26b646a0dd10ddc7a3fb7e56
Related-Bug: #1819963

subject: Possility to connect api_interface to bridge
messages:
[{'account_id': 28438, 'date': '2019-02-25 16:50:36.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 14826, 'date': '2019-02-25 17:15:16.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

I often have api_interface as a bridge. It seems to work fine. The IP address needs to be assigned to the bridge interface though, not interfaces plugged into the bridge. In fact, if you plug an interface into a bridge then any IP assigned to that interface will not work, so I don't see how this could work."}, {'account_id': 14826, 'date': '2019-02-25 17:16:14.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

In that case, api_interface should be the name of the bridge.'}, {'account_id': 28438, 'date': '2019-02-25 17:24:44.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

> In that case, api_interface should be the name of the bridge.

I don't need just to add an interface to a bridge, I want to add an interface to an OpenStack network (based on linuxbridge provider). Thus I don't have a possibility to control naming of the bridge. The proposed solution is to override inventory data.
Current merge requests fixes this bug: https://review.openstack.org/#/c/639157/
Check it please in order to understand the initial issue."}, {'account_id': 14826, 'date': '2019-02-25 17:59:19.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

> > In that case, api_interface should be the name of the bridge.
 > 
 > I don't need just to add an interface to a bridge, I want to add an
 > interface to an OpenStack network (based on linuxbridge provider).
 > Thus I don't have a possibility to control naming of the bridge.
 > The proposed solution is to override inventory data.
 > Current merge requests fixes this bug: https://review.openstack.org/#/c/639157/
 > Check it please in order to understand the initial issue.

I saw the bug. We have a similar problem in ironic, where a node on a neutron provisioning network needs to access the ironic API. What we do in kayobe [1] is to plug the NIC into a linux bridge, then add a veth pair to that bridge, then configure kolla-ansible to plug the other end of the veth into OVS. In your case that would be a linuxbridge.

The key thing is that the bridge created by you is given the internal API network IP. For example:

+---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------+
|  Controller                                                                                             |
|                                                                                                         |
|      +---------------------------------------------------+                                              |
|      | Open vSwitch                                      |                                              |
|      |                                                   |                                              |
|      |     +-----------------+                           |                                              |
|      |     |       OVS       |                           |                                              |
|      |     |                 |  Neutron integration      |                                              |
|      |     |      br-int     |  bridge                   |                                              |
|      |     |                 |                           |                                              |
|      |     |                 |                           |                                              |
|      |     +--------+--------+                           |                                              |
|      |              |                                    |                                              |
|      |              |                                    |                                              |
|      |              |                                    |                                              |
|      |              |                                    |                                              |
|      |     +--------+--------+                           |                                              |
|      |     |       OVS       |                           |                                              |
|      |     |                 |  Neutron physical         |                                              |
|      |     |    breno1-ovs   |  bridge for eno1          |                                              |
|      |     |                 |                           |                                              |
|      |     |                 |                           |                                              |
|      |     +--------+--------+                           |                                              |
|      |              |                                    |                                              |
|      +---------------------------------------------------+                                              |
|                     |                                                                                   |
|                 veth|           +-----------+                                                           |
|                     |           |   VLAN    |  Control & provisioning                                   |
|                     |           |           |  network                                                  |
|            +--------+-------+   | breno1.7  |                                                           |
|            |       LBR      +---+-----------+                                                           |
|            |                |                                          +---------+                      |
|            |     breno1     |                                          |  VLAN   |                      |
|            |                |                                          |         | Power management     |
|            |                +---+-----------+                          | eno3.45 | network              |
|            +--------+-------+   |   VLAN    |  i-Lab external          +---+-----+                      |
|                     |           |           |  network                     |                            |
|                     |           | breno1.60 |                              |                            |
|                     |           +-----------+                              |                            |
|                 +---+---+                                              +---+----+  Control plane        |
|                 |  eno1 |                                              |  eno3  |  management network   |
+-----------------+-------+----------------------------------------------+--------+-----------------------+

[1] https://kayobe.readthedocs.io/en/latest/configuration/network.html#neutron-networking"}, {'account_id': 14826, 'date': '2019-02-25 18:00:54.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

And a more readable version: http://paste.openstack.org/show/746066/.

You then need to set in ml2_conf.ini:

[linuxbridge]
physical_interface_mappings = <physnet>:<veth>'}, {'account_id': 28438, 'date': '2019-02-26 16:55:47.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

> And a more readable version: http://paste.openstack.org/show/746066/.
 > 
 > You then need to set in ml2_conf.ini:
 > 
 > [linuxbridge]
 > physical_interface_mappings = <physnet>:<veth>

Unfortunately this approach doesn't work for native linux bridges:
# brctl addbr br1
# brctl addbr br2
# brctl addif br2 br1
device br1 is a bridge device itself; can't enslave a bridge device to a bridge device."}, {'account_id': 14826, 'date': '2019-02-26 17:08:43.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

> > And a more readable version: http://paste.openstack.org/show/746066/.
 > >
 > > You then need to set in ml2_conf.ini:
 > >
 > > [linuxbridge]
 > > physical_interface_mappings = <physnet>:<veth>
 > 
 > Unfortunately this approach doesn't work for native linux bridges:
 > # brctl addbr br1
 > # brctl addbr br2
 > # brctl addif br2 br1
 > device br1 is a bridge device itself; can't enslave a bridge device
 > to a bridge device.

You missed a vital part - a virtual ethernet pair. You can plug one end into your bridge and give the other end to neutron to plug into its bridge."}, {'account_id': 28438, 'date': '2019-02-27 16:29:45.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

> > > And a more readable version: http://paste.openstack.org/show/746066/.
 > > >
 > > > You then need to set in ml2_conf.ini:
 > > >
 > > > [linuxbridge]
 > > > physical_interface_mappings = <physnet>:<veth>
 > >
 > > Unfortunately this approach doesn't work for native linux
 > bridges:
 > > # brctl addbr br1
 > > # brctl addbr br2
 > > # brctl addif br2 br1
 > > device br1 is a bridge device itself; can't enslave a bridge
 > device
 > > to a bridge device.
 > 
 > You missed a vital part - a virtual ethernet pair. You can plug one
 > end into your bridge and give the other end to neutron to plug into
 > its bridge.

Hm, it works indeed. Thank you!"}, {'account_id': 23717, 'date': '2019-03-27 05:06:49.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+1

LGTM'}, {'account_id': 14826, 'date': '2019-03-27 10:01:13.000000000', 'content': 'Abandoned

Pavel and I discussed and agreed this is not necessary - it can be configured.

Pavel, please restore if I am wrong.'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2019-02-25 16:50:36.000000000', 'message': "Possility to connect api_interface to bridge

When linuxbridge neutron_plagin_agent is used,
in order to provide connectivity between Octavia management
network and physical management network, we have to create
an internal flat network:
openstack network create  --no-share --internal \
  --provider-physical-network osPrivateNet \
  --provider-network-type flat osPrivateNet
This approach allows to provide secure connectivity between
Octavia health manager and Amphora agent in scope of the internal
network.
But in this case code of kolla-ansible fails because it doesn't
expect that api_interface can be connected to a bridge.
Current commit fixes this issue.

The whole solution works only for linuxbridge and doesn't solve the
bug when Open vSwitch is used.

Change-Id: I34bde344c31334e101495447770684ecddf8b836
Closes-Bug: #1719688
"}]
commit_message:
Possility to connect api_interface to bridge

When linuxbridge neutron_plagin_agent is used,
in order to provide connectivity between Octavia management
network and physical management network, we have to create
an internal flat network:
openstack network create  --no-share --internal \
  --provider-physical-network osPrivateNet \
  --provider-network-type flat osPrivateNet
This approach allows to provide secure connectivity between
Octavia health manager and Amphora agent in scope of the internal
network.
But in this case code of kolla-ansible fails because it doesn't
expect that api_interface can be connected to a bridge.
Current commit fixes this issue.

The whole solution works only for linuxbridge and doesn't solve the
bug when Open vSwitch is used.

Change-Id: I34bde344c31334e101495447770684ecddf8b836
Closes-Bug: #1719688

revisions:
[{'created': '2019-03-25 21:01:54.000000000', 'message': 'Check if process' cmdline is "space separarated"

According to proc man page process arguments in /proc/{pid}/cmdline
should be separated with '\0' char and that char was used in
neutron.agent.linux.utils.get_cmdline_from_pid function.

Recently in fullstack tests it was noticed that sometimes it may
happend that those arguments are separated with space char and this
caused failed test because async_process.AsyncProcess() was not able
to check that process is really active.

This patch adds attempt to split cmdline arguments with space in case
when split with '\0' returns only 1 element.

Change-Id: I35d4c0e2cf56fc3ff15cf307aaf11a8ad8489e1f
Closes-Bug: #1820870
'}]
commit_message:
Check if process' cmdline is "space separarated"

According to proc man page process arguments in /proc/{pid}/cmdline
should be separated with '\0' char and that char was used in
neutron.agent.linux.utils.get_cmdline_from_pid function.

Recently in fullstack tests it was noticed that sometimes it may
happend that those arguments are separated with space char and this
caused failed test because async_process.AsyncProcess() was not able
to check that process is really active.

This patch adds attempt to split cmdline arguments with space in case
when split with '\0' returns only 1 element.

Change-Id: I35d4c0e2cf56fc3ff15cf307aaf11a8ad8489e1f
Closes-Bug: #1820870

commit_message:
Don't send SIGHUP to placement-api

Seen in Kayobe CI upgrade job, placement-api exits 129 when sent a
SIGHUP. It doesn't use nova versioned objects, so doesn't need to be
reloaded.

This is a follow-up to Ia4fcc558a3f62ced2d629d7a22d0bc1eb6b879f1.

Change-Id: I38eb8645ee254cc775671c43d3c0fbd5a7402512
Related-bug: #1821362

subject: Password eye icon is reversed
messages:
[{'account_id': 27822, 'date': '2018-11-09 08:08:52.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 8648, 'date': '2018-11-09 09:16:47.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review-1

The icon symbolizes the command. Eye without a slash to show the password, eye with a slash to hide it.'}, {'account_id': 27822, 'date': '2018-11-09 09:32:10.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

> The icon symbolizes the command. Eye without a slash to show the
 > password, eye with a slash to hide it.

yes,But now the eye has no slash to hide the password, and the eye shows it with a slash.'}, {'account_id': 8648, 'date': '2018-11-09 09:57:24.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

In that case it shows the state :-)

You see, we could switch it around every release, and every time half the people would think it's wrong. I think it's best to just leave it be and let the people get used to it."}, {'account_id': 29313, 'date': '2018-11-13 06:21:33.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review-1

I am agree with Radomir Dopieralski. As current functionality seems to be working for user.'}, {'account_id': 841, 'date': '2018-11-20 11:59:12.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

I know the proposed way is the way Google uses, but we need to collect more examples to decide which is a better solution. Could you collect more examples?'}, {'account_id': 841, 'date': '2019-03-07 09:55:20.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: Workflow-1

The bug was expired due to inactivity. What's the status of this change?"}, {'account_id': 27822, 'date': '2019-03-27 09:35:29.000000000', 'content': "Abandoned

I'm sorry,I have no time to collect examples"}]

commit_message:
Password eye icon is reversed

I think fa-eye-slash should be used when hiding passwords.
fa-eye should be used when displaying passwords.

Change-Id: If2a93cb081c9107a843d420b51a2119d646fee1e
Closes-Bug: #1802471

commit_message:
Update UPPER_CONSTRAINTS_FILE for stable/stein

Update the URL to the upper-constraints file to point to the redirect
rule on releases.openstack.org so that anyone working on this branch
will switch to the correct upper-constraints list automatically when
the requirements repository branches.

Until the requirements repository has as stable/stein branch, tests will
continue to use the upper-constraints list on master.

Change-Id: Ib70b619b89583944aa55f6a29bbd72ae0a655c75

[{'created': '2019-03-24 22:26:01.000000000', 'message': 'Replace openstack.org git:// URLs with https://

This is a mechanically generated change to replace openstack.org
git:// URLs with https:// equivalents.

This is in aid of a planned future move of the git hosting
infrastructure to a self-hosted instance of gitea (https://gitea.io),
which does not support the git wire protocol at this stage.

This update should result in no functional change.

For more information see the thread at

 http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-discuss/2019-March/003825.html

Change-Id: Ie54c75f09563edf23f34842978e0fd26acc017ba
'}]
commit_message:
Replace openstack.org git:// URLs with https://

This is a mechanically generated change to replace openstack.org
git:// URLs with https:// equivalents.

This is in aid of a planned future move of the git hosting
infrastructure to a self-hosted instance of gitea (https://gitea.io),
which does not support the git wire protocol at this stage.

This update should result in no functional change.

For more information see the thread at

 http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-discuss/2019-March/003825.html

Change-Id: Ie54c75f09563edf23f34842978e0fd26acc017ba

commit_message:
Adding a udev rule to rename the vf representors.

The vf representors will be created after moving to switchdev mode,
so it's preffered to rename them such  like phys_port_name.

Change-Id: Id41c0899e416ea53255850944e9105a1dba37567

commit_message:
Adding a udev rule to save sriov interface name before configuring switchdev

After moving mlnx interfaces to switchdev mode in sriov, it may
change its name.
So adding a udev rule with PCI address to save the interface name.

Change-Id: I484f8a33ad16aa8815eb9ec60e5c77d776063c39
Closes-Bug: #1820050
(cherry picked from commit 97679372dd4eb7e9039f3a4b083777927100de82)

commit_message:
Temporarily disable TripleO jobs for stable/stein

* TripleO infrastructure for stable/stein is not ready yet so it
  makes sense to disable the corresponding jobs for now.
* "check" jobs left with the the flag "voting" set to "false" so
  we could see when these jobs started passing

Change-Id: Iebbba4c191eed6e735b826d4b48b215884f134f7

[{'created': '2019-03-13 14:50:08.000000000', 'message': "build: handle template syntax errors better

Before:

(venv-for-kolla) 15:35 (s) hrw@puchatek:kolla$ ./tools/build.py --template-only

ERROR:kolla.common.utils:Syntax error in template: ironic-inspector/Dockerfile.j2
ERROR:kolla.common.utils:unexpected '}', expected ']'
INFO:kolla.common.utils:Dockerfiles are generated in /tmp/kolla-2019-03-13_15-44-28_0ovk4xu_/docker

Change-Id: Iaa899f0b81f6698aa86b15977c39af3269d31e9a

commit_message:
build: handle template syntax errors better

Before:

(venv-for-kolla) 15:35 (s) hrw@puchatek:kolla$ ./tools/build.py --template-only
INFO:kolla.common.utils:Found the docker image folder at /home/hrw/devel/linaro/kolla/docker
Traceback (most recent call last):

[.. here goes 100 lines of Jinja2 traceback ..]

jinja2.exceptions.TemplateSyntaxError: unexpected '}', expected ']'

After:

(venv-for-kolla) 15:44 (s) hrw@puchatek:kolla$ ./tools/build.py --template-only
INFO:kolla.common.utils:Found the docker image folder at /home/hrw/devel/linaro/kolla/docker
ERROR:kolla.common.utils:Syntax error in template: ironic-inspector/Dockerfile.j2
ERROR:kolla.common.utils:unexpected '}', expected ']'
INFO:kolla.common.utils:Dockerfiles are generated in /tmp/kolla-2019-03-13_15-44-28_0ovk4xu_/docker

Change-Id: Iaa899f0b81f6698aa86b15977c39af3269d31e9a

commit_message:
Use base.delete_server in test_servers.py

In test_servers.py,
1. base.delete_server can be used to replace the multi lines
   of addCleanUp of deleting server and waiting for server termination.
2. wait_until='ACTIVE' can be passed to create_test_server to
   avoid the extra line of waiting for server active.

Change-Id: Ic6e718cf2e3f251abd89692ada0072b29e71e57b

revisions:
[{'created': '2019-03-21 14:02:33.000000000', 'message': 'Added Openstack Masakari role for the deployment

This commit adds experimental deployment of Masakari role.
It requires existing corosync/pacemaker cluster on compute nodes
for hostmonitors to operate correctly.
Corosync/pacemaker deployment stays out of OSA scope for now.

Change-Id: Ie543885a52f013635b9f553982c3d6448e3cc3aa
'}, {'created': '2019-03-21 14:54:47.000000000', 'message': 'Added Openstack Masakari role for the deployment

This commit adds experimental deployment of Masakari role.
It requires existing corosync/pacemaker cluster on compute nodes
for hostmonitors to operate correctly.

commit_message:
Added Openstack Masakari role for the deployment

This commit adds experimental deployment of Masakari role.
It requires existing corosync/pacemaker cluster on compute nodes
for hostmonitors to operate correctly.
Corosync/pacemaker deployment stays out of OSA scope for now.

Depends-On: Ib33d7bc83f1428763f873e1155fd9e3eb4c937e4
Change-Id: Ie543885a52f013635b9f553982c3d6448e3cc3aa

commit_message:
Respect $USE_PYTHON3 settings for gunicorn

When devstack is configured to use Py3, install and run gunicorn3
to make sure sushy-tools emulator is running under Py3.

Change-Id: If38ef523a8616084f8f715fe247d8a3c8142bf62

After moving mlnx interfaces to switchdev mode in sriov, it may
change its name.

commit_message:
Adding a udev rule to save sriov interface name before configuring switchdev

After moving mlnx interfaces to switchdev mode in sriov, it may
change its name.
So adding a udev rule with PCI address to save the interface name.

Change-Id: I484f8a33ad16aa8815eb9ec60e5c77d776063c39
Closes-Bug: #1820050
(cherry picked from commit 97679372dd4eb7e9039f3a4b083777927100de82)

revisions:
[{'created': '2019-03-18 02:08:48.000000000', 'message': "VNX: update sg in cache

When `destroy_empty_storage_group` is enabled, the sg will be deleted
after the last lun is detached from it. The issue is that the sg cache
isn't updated, which caused the failure of subsequent attaching volumes
to the same host because the sg in the cache will be used directly which
doesn't exist any more.

The fix is updating the sg with poll after deleting it. This doesn't
delete the sg from cache explicitly but makes sure the sg in cache with
latest status `not-exist`. Subsequent attaching will create the sg if it
is `not-exist`.

Closes-bug: #1817385
Change-Id: Ibb39879a77c97c6a5d885461e93116810d16b265
(cherry picked from commit eefd8302b3a01fd5cff0169b6eca0588975ff244)
(cherry picked from commit 1f57f502c893a840ee5021fbca36ae95eed50e73)
(cherry picked from commit 29d42fa73448b3d23d9da4db7b2f407694681ece)
"}]
commit_message:
VNX: update sg in cache

When `destroy_empty_storage_group` is enabled, the sg will be deleted
after the last lun is detached from it. The issue is that the sg cache
isn't updated, which caused the failure of subsequent attaching volumes
to the same host because the sg in the cache will be used directly which
doesn't exist any more.

The fix is updating the sg with poll after deleting it. This doesn't
delete the sg from cache explicitly but makes sure the sg in cache with
latest status `not-exist`. Subsequent attaching will create the sg if it
is `not-exist`.

Closes-bug: #1817385
Change-Id: Ibb39879a77c97c6a5d885461e93116810d16b265
(cherry picked from commit eefd8302b3a01fd5cff0169b6eca0588975ff244)
(cherry picked from commit 1f57f502c893a840ee5021fbca36ae95eed50e73)
(cherry picked from commit 29d42fa73448b3d23d9da4db7b2f407694681ece)

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-12-12 02:25:04.000000000', 'message': 'Remove message about circular role inferences

While Cycles could be a problem, this code was detercting them even
when there were none.  If a role gets added twice, it was reporting
an error, but that is possible from the case where two distinct prior
add the same implied role.  Just move on quietly.

closes-bug 1803780

Change-Id: I804e5084f74ff4afdd582ece02ff2c833c5f6eb1
'}]
commit_message:
Remove message about circular role inferences

While Cycles could be a problem, this code was detercting them even
when there were none.  If a role gets added twice, it was reporting
an error, but that is possible from the case where two distinct prior
add the same implied role.  Just move on quietly.

closes-bug 1803780

Change-Id: I804e5084f74ff4afdd582ece02ff2c833c5f6eb1

commit_message:
Replace openstack.org git:// URLs with https://

This is a mechanically generated change to replace openstack.org
git:// URLs with https:// equivalents.

This is in aid of a planned future move of the git hosting
infrastructure to a self-hosted instance of gitea (https://gitea.io),
which does not support the git wire protocol at this stage.

This update should result in no functional change.

For more information see the thread at

 http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-discuss/2019-March/003825.html

Change-Id: I372590ef2040a9fb5a596948aa5b10a688eb89be

commit_message:
Random IP for concurrent create pf and update_port

Port forwarding test port IP should be specified, otherwise IP
collision may happen between new port IP and router interface IP.
Or sometimes, port new IP and old IP are same.

After this patch, the port new IP will be randomly choiced from
the subset without [old_port_ips, router_interface_ips].

Partially reverts commit 414bdd4c5997886c97d0e3a0b19c684dafeabb7a.

Change-Id: I157e08288765f1716b4cb12bb2e176760db806c0
Closes-Bug: #1818334

revisions:
[{'created': '2019-03-25 03:15:03.000000000', 'message': 'Migrate glance-dsvm-grenade-multinode job to Ubuntu Bionic

We have migrated the zuulv3 job to Bionic during Dec/Jan month.
 - http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-discuss/2018-December/000837.html
 - https://etherpad.openstack.org/p/devstack-bionic
But that effort does not move all gate job to Bionic as there are
large amount of jobs are still legacy jobs. All the legacy jobs still
use Xenial as nodeset.

As per the decided runtime for Stein, we need to test everything on openstack
CI/CD on Bionic - https://governance.openstack.org/tc/reference/runtimes/stein.html

Below patch move the legacy base jobs to bionic which will move the derived jobs
automatically to bionic. These jobs are modified with branch variant so that they will use
Bionic node from stein onwards and xenial for all other stable branches
until stable/rocky.
- https://review.openstack.org/#/c/639096

This commit remove the overridden nodeset in glance-dsvm-grenade-multinode
job so that it will start using the nodeset defined in parent job.

More Details: 
- https://etherpad.openstack.org/p/legacy-job-bionic
- http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-discuss/2019-March/003614.html

Depends-On: https://review.openstack.org/#/c/639096
Change-Id: If30dd7f65e736bdafe579134aac99a00dfc37c09
(cherry picked from commit b46d2d9886e1f2190529162d96806a81d835d6dc)
'}]
commit_message:
Migrate glance-dsvm-grenade-multinode job to Ubuntu Bionic

We have migrated the zuulv3 job to Bionic during Dec/Jan month.
 - http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-discuss/2018-December/000837.html
 - https://etherpad.openstack.org/p/devstack-bionic
But that effort does not move all gate job to Bionic as there are
large amount of jobs are still legacy jobs. All the legacy jobs still
use Xenial as nodeset.

As per the decided runtime for Stein, we need to test everything on openstack
CI/CD on Bionic - https://governance.openstack.org/tc/reference/runtimes/stein.html

Below patch move the legacy base jobs to bionic which will move the derived jobs
automatically to bionic. These jobs are modified with branch variant so that they will use
Bionic node from stein onwards and xenial for all other stable branches
until stable/rocky.
- https://review.openstack.org/#/c/639096

This commit remove the overridden nodeset in glance-dsvm-grenade-multinode
job so that it will start using the nodeset defined in parent job.

More Details: 
- https://etherpad.openstack.org/p/legacy-job-bionic
- http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-discuss/2019-March/003614.html

Depends-On: https://review.openstack.org/#/c/639096
Change-Id: If30dd7f65e736bdafe579134aac99a00dfc37c09
(cherry picked from commit b46d2d9886e1f2190529162d96806a81d835d6dc)

commit_message:
Add "root_execution" mapped property to WorkflowExecution model

* We need to avoid using direct DB queries w/o using a mapped
  model where possible for performance sake. Using a mapped entity
  property is always more efficient because it's cached in an
  SQLAlchemy session.

Change-Id: I2d7652ea0cff8f2db7259d285ac98c582bf15b62

commit_message:
fix tox python3 overrides

We want to default to running all tox environments under python 3, so
set the basepython value in each environment.

We do not want to specify a minor version number, because we do not
want to have to update the file every time we upgrade python.

We do not want to set the override once in testenv, because that
breaks the more specific versions used in default environments like
py35 and py36.

Change-Id: I22f6e478534a5fd90af565812dc81a0fac2f2132

commit_message:
Optimize action scheduling

* If "target" property of a task is empty, there's no need to
  evaluate an expression
* Refactored action input validation logic to avoid preparing
  an action input twice for ad-hoc actions. The method
  "_prepare_input" was previously called twice for ad-hoc actions
  although it may be pretty expensive in some cases.
* Added more profiler decorators to track performance of ad-hoc
  actions

Change-Id: Ia56e2fda57c3af1a86a638018c23dd1c3281debb

commit_message:
Update master for stable/stein

Add file to the reno documentation build to show release notes for
stable/stein.

Use pbr instruction to increment the minor version number
automatically so that master versions are higher than the versions on
stable/stein.

Change-Id: Ic904b0081bc1ec4122e43fbc882cb4b321590b35
Sem-Ver: feature

commit_message:
Drop legacy-grenade-dsvm-neutron-multinode-live-migration

This job doesn't run on stable/ocata changes anyway
due to it's branch restrictions in openstack-zuul-jobs,
becaues there is no stable/newton to upgrade from.

Change-Id: I77c4cbbeccc4e3a814876c08437c15226265b523

> Hi David,

 > There is a length test (4) to ensure the visibilities are added in
 > both create and edit pages. Any suggestions on how I can do it

Hi Andy, you could have added tests which return False to "policyAPI.ifAllowed" and then check the options for the visibility. But I've checked the cover and the ELSE of policyAPI.ifAllowed is not considered as another branch and there is not other tests for this controller which check if NOT Allowed, so you can ignore my previous comment.'}, {'account_id': 26546, 'date': '2018-10-10 07:54:10.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review-1

Hello,

I tried this patch on the current master head and I'm getting the
following behavior:

- When creating a 'community' image from a file, I get an error in the modal:
"AjaxError at /api/glance/images/ invalid visibility option: community..."

- When changing the visiblity of an existing image to 'community' a generic
error is displayed as a Horizon toast:
"Error: Unable to update the image."

It seems to be caused by a failed value validation in 

https://github.com/openstack/horizon/blob/07faca470166341f9010f66cee8195be84435cea/openstack_dashboard/api/glance.py#L470

which doesn't have the 'community' value.'}, {'account_id': 18418, 'date': '2018-11-01 03:55:42.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2: Patch Set 1 was rebased.'}, {'account_id': 18418, 'date': '2018-11-01 03:58:21.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 3: Commit message was updated.'}, {'account_id': 18418, 'date': '2018-11-01 04:01:23.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3:

visibility for an image. With Glance v2, we have 'shared' and
'community' available to us. This commit adds buttons for those
pages selectively when the policy allows it.
It also only displays 'public' visibility if policy allows.

Closes-Bug: #1792411

commit_message:
Support setting more visibility options for edit/create image

The edit and create image pages could only set public or private
visibility for an image. With Glance v2, we have 'shared' and
'community' available to us. This commit adds buttons for those
pages selectively when the policy allows it.
It also only displays 'public' visibility if policy allows.

Closes-Bug: #1792411

Depends-On: https://review.openstack.org/#/c/614688/

Change-Id: I193bc0580e4bf9351ad7f17b148a5062e95313ab

commit_message:
Update UPPER_CONSTRAINTS_FILE for stable/stein

Update the URL to the upper-constraints file to point to the redirect
rule on releases.openstack.org so that anyone working on this branch
will switch to the correct upper-constraints list automatically when
the requirements repository branches.

Until the requirements repository has as stable/stein branch, tests will
continue to use the upper-constraints list on master.

Change-Id: Idd594a0e06015862e5be3306421a0770cf3b7f07

commit_message:
Don't translate event reason when adding hook event

We don't seem to do it anywhere else. TripleO uses hook
reason string comparsion which does not work if
internationalized.

Story: #2005035
Task: 29524
Change-Id: I3e8f4587966969084cbf1e38406cd3cff23eb9a6
(cherry picked from commit 1cd8ce37c038ed79371da60527de35bb75bdfab5)

commit_message:
[Functional] Don't assert that HA router don't have IPs configured

In functional tests of HA router, in
L3AgentTestFramework._router_lifecycle method there was assertion
that HA router at the beginning don't have IPs configured in
router's namespace.

That could lead to test failure because sometimes keepalived process
switched router from standby to master before this assertion was
done and IPs were already configured.

There is alsmost no value in doing this assertion as it's just after
router was created so it is "normal" that there is no IP addresses
configured yet.
Because of that this patch removes this assertion.

Change-Id: Ib509a7226eb94483a0aaf2d930f329e419b8e135
Closes-Bug: #1816489
(cherry picked from commit e6351ab11e2cfaea18ab963e32052ad110d2b899)

[Functional] Don't assert that HA router don't have IPs configured

In functional tests of HA router, in
L3AgentTestFramework._router_lifecycle method there was assertion
that HA router at the beginning don't have IPs configured in
router's namespace.

That could lead to test failure because sometimes keepalived process
switched router from standby to master before this assertion was
done and IPs were already configured.

There is alsmost no value in doing this assertion as it's just after
router was created so it is "normal" that there is no IP addresses
configured yet.
Because of that this patch removes this assertion.

Change-Id: Ib509a7226eb94483a0aaf2d930f329e419b8e135
Closes-Bug: #1816489
(cherry picked from commit e6351ab11e2cfaea18ab963e32052ad110d2b899)

commit_message:
[Functional] Don't assert that HA router don't have IPs configured

In functional tests of HA router, in
L3AgentTestFramework._router_lifecycle method there was assertion
that HA router at the beginning don't have IPs configured in
router's namespace.

That could lead to test failure because sometimes keepalived process
switched router from standby to master before this assertion was
done and IPs were already configured.

There is alsmost no value in doing this assertion as it's just after
router was created so it is "normal" that there is no IP addresses
configured yet.
Because of that this patch removes this assertion.

Change-Id: Ib509a7226eb94483a0aaf2d930f329e419b8e135
Closes-Bug: #1816489
(cherry picked from commit e6351ab11e2cfaea18ab963e32052ad110d2b899)

commit_message:
Replace use of 'is defined' with '!= ""' in ceph-base

Given the issues with I4c6d0b87f4436713ba7080175308ed715907c111 we
try checking if the private_key and python_iterpreter variables are
non empty, instead of defined.

Change-Id: I5054dd57897696ef2c1babeae38f481658c1aa1c

commit_message:
Delete capsule volumes properly

On capsule deletion, iterate all containers inside the container
and detach all volumes in each container.

Change-Id: Id710af2342279b754708e2583d8fe1c90cf2d9ee
Closes-Bug: #1817489
(cherry picked from commit d5faacb333f81c16079449628df4fda313366a4a)

commit_message:
Make domain admin policies consistent for grants

This commit adjust the create and revoke grant
policies to be consistent with other domain admin
policy check strings by not using the
rule:admin_required check string.

Subsequent patches will:
- introduce test coverage for project users and the grants API
- remove redundant policies from policy.v3cloudsample.json

Change-Id: I5970890e554fbd5eb010cba1d82bb0ab1b5de3a2

commit_message:
Update UPPER_CONSTRAINTS_FILE for stable/stein

Update the URL to the upper-constraints file to point to the redirect
rule on releases.openstack.org so that anyone working on this branch
will switch to the correct upper-constraints list automatically when
the requirements repository branches.

Until the requirements repository has as stable/stein branch, tests will
continue to use the upper-constraints list on master.

Change-Id: I3f416a2302c0f210ce08d9d538ebc5926d21eb88

messages: [{'account_id': 16011, 'date': '2019-02-14 18:47:27.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 7353, 'date': '2019-02-25 16:17:09.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+1'}, {'account_id': 28619, 'date': '2019-03-18 17:21:51.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+1'}, {'account_id': 28619, 'date': '2019-03-25 23:43:40.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2\n\nI think, that it's not really required to change includes to imports outside main.yml, because there are no tags for included roles outside it. However patch is really required, as fixes bug."}, {'account_id': 7353, 'date': '2019-03-27 02:07:13.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Commit message was updated.'}, {'account_id': 7353, 'date': '2019-03-27 02:07:23.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2019-02-14 18:47:27.000000000', 'message': '[DNM] Convert dynamic includes to static imports

When task files are included using include_tasks, tags are not passed to the
included tasks. As a result, tags like neutron-config do not have the intended
effect. This patch changes include_tasks to import_tasks for all cases where
dynamic vars or loops are not used so that tags are properly handled.

Reference -
https://docs.ansible.com/ansible/latest/user_guide/playbooks_reuse.html
https://bugs.launchpad.net/openstack-ansible/+bug/1815043

Change-Id: I525265255b19018536365272f5a48baa486f8a0c
'}, {'created': '2019-03-27 02:07:13.000000000', 'message': 'Convert dynamic includes to static imports

When task files are included using include_tasks, tags are not passed to the
included tasks. As a result, tags like neutron-config do not have the intended
effect. This patch changes include_tasks to import_tasks for all cases where
dynamic vars or loops are not used so that tags are properly handled.

Reference -
https://docs.ansible.com/ansible/latest/user_guide/playbooks_reuse.html
https://bugs.launchpad.net/openstack-ansible/+bug/1815043

Change-Id: I525265255b19018536365272f5a48baa486f8a0c
'}]
commit_message:
Convert dynamic includes to static imports

When task files are included using include_tasks, tags are not passed to the
included tasks. As a result, tags like neutron-config do not have the intended
effect. This patch changes include_tasks to import_tasks for all cases where
dynamic vars or loops are not used so that tags are properly handled.

Reference -
https://docs.ansible.com/ansible/latest/user_guide/playbooks_reuse.html
https://bugs.launchpad.net/openstack-ansible/+bug/1815043

Change-Id: I525265255b19018536365272f5a48baa486f8a0c

commit_message:
Add image_source to containers

Previously when containers were added to the upstream kolla project or
added to our container list, the container build process might try and
build them when we execute kolla-build.  This change adds a image_source
parameter that is used to understand when we should and should not
attempt to build the container with kolla witht he 'overcloud container
image build' command.

Change-Id: I82d6e09c856f78c0b29d7324c59b5e00bf5ae04d
Closes-BUg: #1801969
(cherry picked from commit 8abbdeb42300ed64f15f1041492ebc895e49dee9)

commit_message:
Add manila as a configured component

Manila can be used with openstack and when deployed in a venv the ceph
client role will need to link the appropriate libs into the venv for
this to work. This change adds manila into the default component list so
that should manila be deployed it'll be automatically configured without
needing to provide an override.

Change-Id: I732066e3a3aea77c2c7e43398c833bba1664fde0
Signed-off-by: cloudnull <kevin@cloudnull.com>

commit_message:
Fix reload notification file

We want to trigger the reload on the localtime file (/etc/localtime) not
the actual zone file because that is the symlink that gets updated when
the timezone is changed.

NOTE: This is <= Rocky only because we switched to ansible managment in
Stein.

Change-Id: I2bdafeb59c3feb86a30a46eeb803bc9795c9c820
Closes-Bug: #1819548

commit_message:
Fix capsule volume attach

In before, the schema 'requested_volume' parameter is different
between container and capsule. As the container and capsule
model being consolidated [1][2], it is better to unify the
schema of this parameter so that it is easier to maintain.

[1] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/636070/
[2] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/633371/

Closes-Bug: #1817488
Change-Id: Ifac6660230c926747ccfabb7d923f42825f30acc
(cherry picked from commit dd933447c024d0340c3d010da53bf61a723cd0cc)

revisions:
[{'created': '2019-03-26 16:14:02.000000000', 'message': "Document a warning about using the JsonFilter

People hit problems using the JsonFilter from time to time
and at least I always have to re-learn what it does and am
somewhat horrified to find how flexible it is based on using
HostState attributes as filtering variables, not to mention
we don't do any functional testing with it. The docs are also
misleading in stating it only supports a subset of variables
when it's really anything on the HostState object. A common
case is people filtering on the hypervisor_hostname attribute
to schedule directly to a specific baremetal node with ironic.

This change adds a warning recommending to not use the filter
if possible and find alternatives, like traits. It also mentions
the HostState object as defining the variables that can be used
along with adding the commonly-used hypervisor_hostname variable
to the list.

Change-Id: Ib2b1395715b6bdb25f53ee7c68df44e2d84b895b
Related-Bug: #1821764
"}]
commit_message:
Document a warning about using the JsonFilter

People hit problems using the JsonFilter from time to time
and at least I always have to re-learn what it does and am
somewhat horrified to find how flexible it is based on using
HostState attributes as filtering variables, not to mention
we don't do any functional testing with it. The docs are also
misleading in stating it only supports a subset of variables
when it's really anything on the HostState object. A common
case is people filtering on the hypervisor_hostname attribute
to schedule directly to a specific baremetal node with ironic.

This change adds a warning recommending to not use the filter
if possible and find alternatives, like traits. It also mentions
the HostState object as defining the variables that can be used
along with adding the commonly-used hypervisor_hostname variable
to the list.

Change-Id: Ib2b1395715b6bdb25f53ee7c68df44e2d84b895b
Related-Bug: #1821764

commit_message:
Fix JsonFilter query hint examples in docs

The API reference and part of the scheduler filter docs for
the JsonFilter query hint are using invalid json strings
in the examples.

This fixes both invalid locations using the same json string
used in the openstack server create command example in the
scheduler admin docs.

Change-Id: Iaab8608c7ffa6fbbea40a838dd02d8096f632f7a
Closes-Bug: #1821764

commit_message:
Replace openstack.org git:// URLs with https://

This is a mechanically generated change to replace openstack.org
git:// URLs with https:// equivalents.

This is in aid of a planned future move of the git hosting
infrastructure to a self-hosted instance of gitea (https://gitea.io),
which does not support the git wire protocol at this stage.

This update should result in no functional change.

For more information see the thread at

 http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-discuss/2019-March/003825.html

Change-Id: I84db79fd691b726fcf298b682be63b232127ede4

commit_message:
Fix reload notification file

We want to trigger the reload on the localtime file (/etc/localtime) not
the actual zone file because that is the symlink that gets updated when
the timezone is changed.

NOTE: This is <= Rocky only because we switched to ansible managment in
Stein.

Change-Id: I2bdafeb59c3feb86a30a46eeb803bc9795c9c820
Closes-Bug: #1819548
(cherry picked from commit ac4bd32a70db90f55100bb74f939dad99547cde3)

commit_message:
Update role for new source build process

The variables barbican_developer_mode and barbican_venv_download
no longer carry any meaning. This review changes glance to
do the equivalent of what developer_mode was all the time,
meaning that it always builds the venv and never requires
the repo server, but it will use a repo server when available.

As part of this, we move the source build out of its own file
because it's now a single task to include the venv build role.
This is just to make it easier to follow the code.

Depends-On: https://review.openstack.org/647813
Change-Id: Ia3c69c1f8a9487481e1275875701cf3d77c2d231

commit_message:
Convert the cinder playbook to use newer ansible syntax

The cinder plabook has been converted from using "include" with playbooks
as this funciton has ben deprecated and is set to be removed. The
serialization of the cinder playbook has been impacted by the removal
of this function and will need to be reworked should we discover issues
with the installation process using the new layout.

The common-playbook for cinder has been removed as it no longer servers any
purpose. The tasks within the playbook have been rolled into the
os-cinder-install.yml playbook which should retain the exact same functionality
within the pre_tasks section.

Change-Id: I70ab57cf3ac52e176563204356602a19191616bc
Signed-off-by: Kevin Carter <kevin@cloudnull.com>

commit_message:
Convert the glance playbook to use newer ansible syntax

The glance plabook has been converted from using "include" with playbooks
as this funciton has ben deprecated and is set to be removed. The
serialization of the glance playbook has been impacted by the removal
of this function and will need to be reworked should we discover issues
with the installation process using the new layout.

The common-playbook for glance has been removed as it no longer servers any
purpose. The tasks within the playbook have been rolled into the
os-glance-install.yml playbook which should retain the exact same functionality
within the pre_tasks section.

Change-Id: Ia8ed95d276f3092c4e50d6c434bd025101491fca
Signed-off-by: Kevin Carter <kevin@cloudnull.com>

commit_message:
Convert the neutron playbook to use newer ansible syntax

The neutron plabook has been converted from using "include" with playbooks
as this funciton has ben deprecated and is set to be removed. The
serialization of the neutron playbook has been impacted by the removal
of this function and will need to be reworked should we discover issues
with the installation process using the new layout.

The common-playbook for neutron has been removed as it no longer servers any
purpose. The tasks within the playbook have been rolled into the
os-neutron-install.yml playbook which should retain the exact same functionality
within the pre_tasks section.

Change-Id: Iddb3389472bfaf7e99be051427fbb5cc7eb5f62a
Signed-off-by: Kevin Carter <kevin@cloudnull.com>

commit_message:
Convert the nova playbook to use newer ansible syntax

The nova plabook has been converted from using "include" with playbooks
as this funciton has ben deprecated and is set to be removed. The
serialization of the nova playbook has been impacted by the removal
of this function and will need to be reworked should we discover issues
with the installation process using the new layout.

The common-playbook for nova has been removed as it no longer servers any
purpose. The tasks within the playbook have been rolled into the
os-nova-install.yml playbook which should retain the exact same functionality
within the pre_tasks section.

Change-Id: Ibf7e663c682f0884fd1de71a59c0b5b94bb902b2
Signed-off-by: Kevin Carter <kevin@cloudnull.com>

commit_message:
Remove vif_plugin_is_fatal and vif_plugin_timeout values

We are setting these values to False and 10 seconds
respectively and by default it is set to True and 300
seconds, which is the desirable because we don't want
and instance to boot if there was timeout to plug in a
VIF. Also, 10 seconds is a really short timeout for this

Depends-On: https://review.openstack.org/642842/
Change-Id: I4698d04e08fd0aa162c81d4a4af37a42e938d4f1
(cherry picked from commit 30952d23ec4a136db2fc741534172795c0086fac)

[{'created': '2019-02-14 05:34:59.000000000', 'message': 'Add venv build host to the group vars for integrated deployments

This change adds the venv build targets and host to group_vars all which
will ensure all hosts have a valid build target. This change will enable
all openstack services to build on a designated node which will speed up
the build process for all services and provide flexibility in a
multi-distro, multi-arch environment.

Change-Id: I0684f338e6b3b6a96e33a5db651055940bd7a351

commit_message:
Add venv build host to the group vars for integrated deployments

This change adds the venv build targets and host to group_vars all which
will ensure all hosts have a valid build target. This change will enable
all openstack services to build on a designated node which will speed up
the build process for all services and provide flexibility in a
multi-distro, multi-arch environment.

Change-Id: I0684f338e6b3b6a96e33a5db651055940bd7a351
Signed-off-by: cloudnull <kevin@cloudnull.com>

subject: Force chrony restart on config change
messages: [{'account_id': 14985, 'date': '2019-03-26 22:53:44.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 3153, 'date': '2019-03-27 01:07:21.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2019-03-26 22:53:44.000000000', 'message': "Force chrony restart on config change

We've seen handlers being inconsitently being ignored for some
deployments when we force a handler flush mid-playbook. We'll need to
ensure the config is properly loaded if we want to follow up with
subsequent chronyc application so it's best to always invoke the restart
when the configuration actually changes.

Change-Id: I5292f1b1bd65cef340e1e9742463620effc30d26
"}]
commit_message:
Force chrony restart on config change

We've seen handlers being inconsitently being ignored for some
deployments when we force a handler flush mid-playbook. We'll need to
ensure the config is properly loaded if we want to follow up with
subsequent chronyc application so it's best to always invoke the restart
when the configuration actually changes.

Change-Id: I5292f1b1bd65cef340e1e9742463620effc30d26
